Over $1 Million Grand Harbor Marina Amenities Neighborhood Map Oak Harbor Neighborhood Map ABOUT AMAC NEIGHBORHOOD EXPERTS Contact Us Menu 772-231-6509 Facebook YouTube Instagram Grand Harbor Real Estate in Vero Beach SEARCH NOW Welcome to Grand Harbor Located on the western banks of the Indian River/Intracoastal Waterway, Grand Harbor is a Certified Audubon Community International Sanctuary and Vero's only mainland community that offers a full amenity package and a "Grand Lifestyle." Five-star amenities are extensive including two Joe Lee and Pete Dye championship golf courses, a 32,000 square foot grandiose Mediterranean clubhouse with four diverse venues for dinning, 161-slip protected deep water marine, tennis center with 10 Har-Tru courts, 2 stadium courts, pickle ball courts, 3 bocce ball courts, a modern fitness center, and a jam-packed social calendar. Also just a 10-minute drive from Grand Harbor neighborhoods is the private, staffed, oceanfront Beach Club with amenities that include an oceanfront swimming pool, beach cabanas, and oceanfront dining. Grand Harbor offers many monthly social events which include theme parties, dinner shows, golf invitational, tennis exhibitions, and all kinds of special interest clubs. Plus volunteerism via our "Community Outreach" is a common thread weaving through the heart of the community, The real estate choices are just as numerous with 1-, 2-, 3-, or 4- bedroom single family homes, estate homes, condominiums, duplexes, or villas in every style, size and price range located on the golf course, on the water, at the marina, or along the Indian River. Home Page - Oak Harbor Chamber of Commerce Skip to content Menu HOME RELOCATING Moving to Whidbey Island Retiring on Whidbey Island MILITARY SUPPORT Oak Harbor Military Affairs Committee Military Relocation EVENTS Calendar 2025 Monthly Luncheons Business Community After Hours Whidbey Island Culture Fest Independence Day Celebration Whidbey Wags 5th Annual Collaborative Golf Tournament Military Appreciation Picnic 2025 Awards Banquet New Year’s Eve Fireworks VISIT WHIDBEY ISLAND Discover Oak Harbor Visitor Information Center Vacation on Whidbey Where To Go, What To Do Filming and Photography in Island County CHAMBER MEMBERS Member Login Join the Chamber Today Business Directory Become a Chamber Ambassador Volunteer ABOUT US Contact Us About Us Oak Harbor Chamber of Commerce Staff Board of Directors Job Postings Popular Links SEPTEMBER LUNCHEON 2025 CHAMBER BANQUET MORE EVENTS Our Mission Founded in 1946 as a nonprofit, the Greater Oak Harbor Chamber of Commerce has long been dedicated to supporting both community and business growth. Throughout the years, it has focused on promoting civic engagement and creating opportunities for Oak Harbor residents to come together in celebration and advocacy. Today, this legacy of service continues, fueled by the passion and commitment of the Chamber’s Board, Staff, Ambassadors, and Volunteers. Together, they work tirelessly to strengthen the community, ensuring Oak Harbor remains a vibrant, connected, and welcoming place for everyone. Home - Oak Harbor Skip to content Home The Club About Gallery Lifestyle and Activities Extensive Sports and Social Activities Dining Wellness Home Health Services Membership Real Estate Resales Contact Us Home The Club About Gallery Lifestyle and Activities Extensive Sports and Social Activities Dining Wellness Home Health Services Membership Real Estate Resales Contact Us You Deserve A Carefree Life Oak Harbor is a gated community of luxury single family homes, villas, cottages and condominiums.  Located on the Indian River, near Vero Beach’s art and cultural district as well as the area’s medical corridor centered on Cleveland Clinic Indian River Hospital.  Residents at Oak Harbor enjoy luxurious green landscapes and interesting waterways.  Centered in the community is the Oak Harbor Club, a premiere country club for residents wanting to enjoy an active lifestyle of sporting amenities, as well as social clubs and events.  Amenities are available through membership in the Oak Harbor Club. The Oak Harbor Club- Enjoy the Best! The Oak Harbor Club is a premier lifestyle country club specifically designed for the active lifestyle of members over  55.  The Club sits at the center of the Oak Harbor community and offers a number of sporting activities as well as a full range of social activities.  The Club’s 9 hole Joe Lee designed golf course offers members the ability for leisure play as well as competitive events, including Men’s Day, Ladies Day and our very popular Saturday Scramble.  The Club also offers leisure and club match croquet on a beautifully groomed croquet lawn.  For those wanting racquet sports, the Club offers tennis on a clay court and pickleball on a grass court.  The Club also has an active bocce league. The intimate size of the Oak Harbor Club is one of its most distinctive qualities.  By keeping membership exclusive, the Club ensures that members can easily confirm a dinner reservation or enjoy a round of golf without needing a tee time.  The Club’s smaller size encourages frequent and meaningful social connections, making Oak Harbor more than just a place to stay active–it’s a community where friendships thrive. Lifestyle & Activities Extensive Sports and Social Activities The Oak Harbor Club offers a complete array of activities for active Members and their guests. The Club’s 9 hole Joe Lee designed golf course offers members the ability for leisure play as well as competitive events, including Men’s Day, Ladies Day and our very popular Saturday Scramble.  Golf clinics and lessons are available from the Club’s Class “A” PGA professional. The Club’s croquet program offers individual play as well as round-robin events and interclub match play.  And they have their ever popular Wine N Wickets events. The Club offers racquet sports of tennis on a clay court, as well as the very popular pickleball which we play on a well-maintained grass court.  The Club’s racquet sports are available for casual or competitive play.  Lesson are available on site. There is weekly bocce drop in play as well as a bocce league during the winter season. The Health and Wellness Center has a fitness center with classes in yoga, Qi Gong, Aquacise, Stretch & Tone as well as chair exercise classes.  There is a pool and Jacuzzi available from dawn to dusk as well as a fitness center with a full range of equipment and weights. In the Clubhouse, you will find Monday Movie Matinee, Tuesday Trivia, Thursday Dinner with John Ryan at the piano, Friday Bingo and Dinner, as well as Lounge Happy Hour events.  Also available are Contract Bridge and Mah Jongg.  Special events are scheduled throughout the year. Lifestyle - 
Living the Good Life The Oak Harbor Club offers a plethora of activities including contract bridge, Mah Jongg and Book Club.  Tech Savy classes and movie events are offered on a weekly basis.  Members have the ability to structure their days to their liking.  The days can include sports activities or individual fitness time. Our extensive library has the latest periodicals and books for our Members’ enjoyment. Meeting up with other members at the Clubhouse Lounge for a cocktail before dinner or for a night of Trivia are Member favorites. It is said that the only time you retire at Oak Harbor is when you retire to your bed at night. The 42,000 square foot clubhouse transports its members to elegant dining and social events.  The Clubhouse hosts both casual and more formal dining for our Members’ enjoyment.  It also houses the Club’s fitness center, pool and Jacuzzi.  Meeting rooms are available for many social amenities, including bridge and Mah Jongg. Also located inside the Club’s massive Clubhouse is the Oak Harbor Fitness Center outfitted with state-of-the-art equipment for group and individual training. The Clubhouse is also where you will find Oak Harbor Home Health.  For members who desire additional assistance with their daily health challenges, Oak Harbor Home Health is here to provide Members with a full array of services that allow our Members to remain in their homes while receiving care. From the 9 hole, Joe Lee designed golf course, croquet, impressive Galas, and the exquisite cuisine, this is a way of life like no other. Our nationally recognized Wellness Program recently expanded to include concierge-like services from our in-house health services team. Oak Harbor Club offers three membership choices to fit the individual needs of our members. For Your Dining Pleasure The Club’s impressive 42,000 square foot Clubhouse offers choices for your dining pleasure.  The formal dining room offers creative chef-prepared menus.  Or for a less formal evening, Members enjoy the Sunroom which offers a selection of lighter fare.  The Club also has a private dining room where Members can arrange for smaller gatherings for family or special dinners with friends. Health & Wellness Geared To Your Specific Needs The focus of the Club’s Wellness Program is to enhance the overall quality of daily life for our members by gently supervising Members to achieve their optimal level of physical fitness.  The Club’s philosophy is a gradual, yet continuous dedication to increasing your levels of stability, coordination, flexibility and muscular strength. The Club’s unique Health and Wellness Center is staffed by an on-site nursing staff who assists and advises Members with various medical matters including designing the proper home health care program when needed.  The care provided through the Oak Harbor Home Health allows Members’ families to know that their family member is receiving the best care in their own home. Members needing a more concentrated level of care can make arrangements through the Club’s Health and Wellness Center to enter Somerset House for short or long-term rehabilitation or for continuing assisted living. The facilities and services offered through the Club’s Health and Wellness Center provide a point of difference at Oak Harbor Club.  This amenity is one of the ways that the Oak Harbor Club keeps its Members’ needs as a central focus of the Club. Services Companion care Collect newspapers/mail Personal shopping Local doctor appointments Nurse visits (RN/LPN) In home care by a Home Health Aide (“HHA”) or a Certified Nurses Assistant (“CNA”) Medication management Blood pressure and vitals readings on a periodic basis (daily, weekly, or monthly) Respite care Hospital and rehab stay companion Memberships At Oak Harbor Club our memberships are designed to allow the member to select the amenities that most appeal to their desires.  Three different membership plans are available:  Country Club, Associate, and House.  The selection runs from unlimited golf to enjoying the social aspects of the Club.  All of the memberships provide for full use of the gorgeous Clubhouse and its dining facilities as well as the Club fitness, health and social programs. All Memberships provide for participation in the Oak Harbor Home Health as well as entrance to Somerset House on a priority basis, if needed. A personal meeting with the Membership Director will provide you with a private tour of the Club and allow you to review the three membership levels so that you can design a program that best meets your lifestyle and individual needs. Real Estate Our exceptional collection of homes blends timeless architectural style with uncompromising luxury and convenience. Oak Harbor’s superb lifestyle choices include elegant cottages, gracious condominiums, and grand villas offering scenic views of lakes, the golf course, and serene wildlife estuaries. Harbor Marina Amenities Neighborhood Map Oak Harbor Neighborhood Map ABOUT AMAC NEIGHBORHOOD EXPERTS Contact Us Menu 772-231-6509 Facebook YouTube Instagram About Oak Harbor Oak Harbor is Vero Beach’s premier adult community nestled in its own tropical paradise near the Intracoastal on Vero’s mainland. Thoughtful in every detail, the community offers superb lifestyle choices, outstanding amenities, intellectually stimulating and culturally rich activities, and unparalleled service in a carefree, no-maintenance lifestyle. Reserved exclusively for Members, no tee time is required on the Joe Lee-designed 9-hole executive course with its far-reaching fairways and lush rolling hills.  An alternative to golf might be croquet on the beautiful regulation size court.  Prefer tennis?  Along with regular courts there are also grass Pickleball courts in addition to Bocce ball courts. The 42,000 square foot clubhouse provides varied dining options from casual to black-tie. The 5-star, award winning chef prepared meals are served in the formal dining room, the bright informal sunroom, elegant private dining room, or the lovely lounge, every dining mood is accommodated.  Oak Harbor also hosts a wide variety of events through the year including dinner parties, holiday events, dancing, galas, performance acts and shows.  The clubhouse affords residents a quiet, cozy cherry paneled library, an activity room, card room, a well-equipped fitness area with locker rooms, sauna, and individual fitness training, and a swimming pool for leisure or Aquatics.  Additionally, an on-site hairdresser and manicurist is available to pamper residents. Nearby the clubhouse, Somerset House is an assisted living facility exclusively for Oak Harbor members. Residents needing short or long-term rehabilitation or care benefit from the at-home atmosphere and comforts offered in its 30 private rooms. Somerset has a well-trained nursing staff 24-hours a day with a senior registered nurse always on call during the late evening hours. Learn about Somerset House services and personal Home Health Services below. The “Carefree Lifestyle” provided at Oak Harbor includes chauffeur-driven transportation, daily housekeeping, home maintenance, and an in-depth, full-time concierge that handles a range of business services, along with letter and package send-off. Most Popular Number: (800) 285-6254 Total calls: 17 Issue resolved: 1 Last call: May 8, 2024 Winnie Murugi PissedConsumer Reporter What Is The Oak Harbor Freight Lines Customer Service Phone Number? As a leading provider of transportation and logistics services, Oak Harbor Freight Lines values the importance of maintaining effective communication channels with its customers. In order to facilitate seamless and efficient communication, the company has established a dedicated Oak Harbor Lines customer service phone number that can be accessed by customers from across the country. The primary Oak Harbor Lines phone number to call is 8002856254. 57% of consumers used this number to address their issues and concerns. The longest wait times are on Wednesday, while the shortest are on Friday and Thursday. What Is The Oak Harbor Freight Lines Email Address? People email Oak Harbor Freight Lines mainly because of employment, requests for information, shipping and delivery. The best email to contact Oak Harbor Freight Lines is custsvc@oakh.com. Alternatively, you can message their Help Center online via their social media pages. They usually respond to direct messages within several business hours. To assist their reps with properly responding to your experience, please ensure that you include as much information as you can. What Is The Oak Harbor Freight Lines Headquarters Address? The Oak Harbor Freight Lines headquarters are located at Oak Harbor Freight Lines, Inc. 1339 West Valley Hwy North, PO Box 1469, Auburn, WA 98071-1469. This is their head office – here you will find: Underwriting; Marketing; Finance; IT; Accounts; Customer Relations; HR; Legal; Compliance and corporate communications. It's the main hub for all administrative and corporate functions of the company. If you need to get in touch with Oak Harbor Freight Lines or want to visit their headquarters, this is the address to use. Meet the Team — Clear Harbor Asset Management facebook twitter instagram linkedin google youtube vimeo tumblr yelp rss email podcast phone blog search brokercheck brokercheck Play Pause Who We Are Our Services Insights Client Access Contact Who We Are About Us Meet the Team Letter From Our CEO Our Services Wealth Management Investment Management Values-Based Portfolio Construction Insights Clear Harbor in the News Market Outlook Flash News and Updates Client Access Contact Your Partners in Wealth Management Schedule Time to Meet With Us About Us Meet the Team Letter From Our CEO Get to Know Us Read Bio Aaron J. Kennon Co-Founder & Chief Executive Officer Close Aaron J. Kennon Co-Founder & Chief Executive Officer Aaron serves as Chief Executive Officer of Clear Harbor Asset Management and is a member of the firm's Investment Committee. He has spent the last twenty-seven years focused on domestic and international capital markets across trading, asset management, and wealth planning. Prior to co-founding Clear Harbor, Aaron managed multi-asset class portfolios for institutions and high-net-worth individuals at Ingalls & Snyder LLC. Before joining Ingalls, Aaron worked at the Royal Bank of Canada, where he was responsible for expanding the firm’s presence in dollar-denominated institutional fixed income trading. During his tenure at RBC, Aaron worked and lived in both London and New York. Prior to joining the Royal Bank of Canada, Aaron worked at Citigroup Inc. for 9 years, where he focused on fixed income capital markets, with a particular emphasis on trading and originating high-grade fixed income securities. While working for Citigroup, Aaron worked and lived in Manhattan, Tokyo and Hong Kong. A graduate of Yale University, Aaron currently serves on the board of the Atlantic Salmon Federation (U.S.) and is also a member of the organization's Investment and Finance Committees. Read Bio Ian A. Armstrong, CAIA© Co-Founder & Chief Operating Officer Close Ian A. Armstrong, CAIA© Co-Founder & Chief Operating Officer Ian serves as Chief Operating Officer of Clear Harbor Asset Management and is a member of the firm's Investment Committee. Prior to co-founding Clear Harbor, Ian was employed as an Associate at Ingalls & Snyder LLC. At Ingalls, Ian served as an Analyst and Trader for one of the firm’s multi-strategy hedge funds. His responsibilities at the fund encompassed a broad range of strategies, including special situation equities, capital structure arbitrage and high yield and distressed debt. Ian was also responsible for monitoring and hedging the fund’s aggregate risk exposures. In addition to his role with the fund, Ian also managed individual accounts for personal clients. Prior to joining Ingalls & Snyder, Ian was employed as Investment Operations Manager for Cruice Investment Advisors Ltd, a boutique investment firm in Westport, CT. At Cruice, Ian was responsible for a wide range of the firm’s investment operations, including trading, client reporting, research distribution and technology management. Earning a bachelor’s degree in economics from Indiana University, Ian combines his experience and education to provide unmatched service to his clients. Read Bio D. Roger B. Liddell Vice-Chairman & Investment Manager Close D. Roger B. Liddell Vice-Chairman & Investment Manager Roger serves as Vice Chairman of Clear Harbor Asset Management and is an Investment Manager and a member of the firm’s Investment Committee. Prior to joining Clear Harbor, Roger was a Partner, Senior Director and Managing Director for 22 years at Ingalls & Snyder, LLC. His areas of specialization include energy renewable electricity, utilities and special situations. Within the energy sector, he concentrates on demand-side versus supply-side opportunities as well as providers of energy-efficient equipment and energy management services. He offers perspective on electric rate structures, price signals and efficiency programs. Roger has been active with major environmental organizations such as Natural Resources Defense Council since the mid-1970s in efforts to establish policies supportive of rational energy markets. In this pro bono activity, he encourages regulators and companies to re-direct capital expenditures toward efficiency investments in lieu of additional capacity. He is a member of the Sharon (CT) Energy and Environment Commission and Stewardship Committee Chairman and Board Member of the Sharon Land trust. Roger is a graduate of Princeton University (A.B. English Literature) and following his service as a U.S. Navy  Officer, he went on to earn his master’s degree in finance and security analysis from Columbia University. Read Bio Tim Schantz Vice-Chairman Close Tim Schantz Vice-Chairman Tim Schantz serves as Vice Chairman of Clear Harbor Asset Management and his career in finance and wealth management spans more than 35 years. Tim served as president of ING Capital and later as president of the combined ING Furman Selz Asset Management. He also worked as head of ING's corporate and structured finance business in the Americas, and Deutsche Bank's structured finance activities within private wealth management in the U.S. before joining Genworth as head of alternative investing. Tim has also served as a strategy consultant for Greenwich Associates. Tim has extensive experience in the not-for-profit sector as well, having served as a board member for a number of entities in addition to his executive roles. Prior to joining Clear Harbor's board, Tim led the Mountbatten Institute in North America and more recently the Protestant Episcopal Cathedral Foundation in Washington, D.C. as its Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer. Tim has served as a member of the Compensation and Governance Committees for the Board of Questex Media and has been a Director and Chairman of the Nominating and Governance Committee for MortgageIT, a NYSE listed company, prior to its acquisition by Deutsche Bank. Tim is currently a member of the executive leadership team at History Factory in Washington where he serves as Chief Administrative Officer and Managing Director of Archives and Content Solutions.  Additionally, he serves as Chairman of the Investment Committee and as a Councilor for the Historical Society of Pennsylvania and also serves on the Advisory Board of the Smithsonian Libraries, acting as Chairman of the Education Committee and as a member of the Executive Committee. Tim studied history at Brown University and currently resides in Washington, D.C. with his wife. Read Bio Henrik Brun Managing Director Close Henrik Brun Managing Director Henrik serves as a Managing Director at Clear Harbor Asset Management specializing in providing financial strategy advice to his clients - both individuals and not-for-profits - in the areas of asset allocation, asset and liability management, in-depth personal balance sheets, as well as college and retirement planning. Henrik has extensive experience designing portfolios that include ESG, Carbon-reduction strategies, Innovation, and public/private funds. He brings more than two decades of multi-jurisdictional knowledge drawing from his experience with clients in the US, Europe, and Asia. Prior to joining Clear Harbor, Henrik was at Stonehurst Management for 18 years and prior to that at UBS Financial Services. Henrik holds an MBA from NYU Stern School of Business and a Bachelor of Arts from Brown University. Henrik serves on the Investment Committee for the NY Institute for Special Education overseeing a $250 million endowment and a $20 million Defined Benefit plan. Henrik’s pro bono interests include moving cancer research forward by doing Cycle For Survival and founding ProjectLIV with his family to connect leading labs with Memorial Sloan Kettering’s cBioPortal (the largest cancer genomic resource in the world). Henrik lives in Manhattan with his two sons. Read Bio Scott Bogan Portfolio Manager Close Scott Bogan Portfolio Manager Scott brings 25 years of financial advisory experience, specializing in investment management, portfolio construction, and asset allocation. His expertise includes relative valuation analysis, risk management for concentrated stock positions, and comprehensive financial planning. Scott has worked extensively with corporate executives and other high-net-worth individuals, providing tailored financial solutions that align with their long-term goals. Before joining Clear Harbor, he held investment advisory roles at both GYL Financial Synergies and Morgan Stanley. He was also affiliated with Mass Mutual and Northwestern Mutual, where he provided holistic financial planning. Earlier in his career, he worked in brand management at General Foods/Kraft. Scott holds a B.A. from Middlebury College, cum laude, where he majored in Political Science with an additional concentration in French Language and Civilization. He also studied at l’Institut d’Études Politiques in Paris, France. Beyond his professional endeavors, Scott is an avid skier and former racer. He actively volunteers with the Alumni Association for Burke Mountain Academy in Vermont, staying engaged with downhill racing and mentoring student-athletes. He also serves as a trustee of the Wilton (CT) Land Conservation Trust, contributing to its Land Stewardship Committee. Scott and his family are dedicated supporters of the community YMCA and enjoy kayaking, hiking, skiing, traveling, and attending concerts of all genres. Read Bio Jacques Cattier Portfolio Manager Close Jacques Cattier Portfolio Manager Jacques serves as a Portfolio Manager at Clear Harbor Asset Management.  Prior to joining Clear Harbor, Jacques was employed for 25 years as a Portfolio Manager at Security Asset Management (now a division of Clear Harbor) where he was responsible for the investment selection and portfolio management of the firm’s “Emerging Blue Chip” equity strategy. Jacques is a periodic contributor to the financial website TheStreet.com.  Earning a bachelor’s degree in economics from Trinity College, Jacques’ career long focus has been to partner with individuals, families and institutions to craft portfolios built of high-quality investments with long term compounding return potential. Jacques lives in Manhattan with his wife and two children. Read Bio Robert C. Dalldorf Portfolio Manager Close Robert C. Dalldorf Portfolio Manager Bob serves as a Portfolio Manager at Clear Harbor Asset Management.  Prior to joining Clear Harbor, Bob was employed by Falcon Capital Management, Inc., an independent registered investment advisor, as both President and CCO.  In that role he built out the firm’s equity and fixed income strategies, developed business, and managed both portfolios and relationships.  As Chief Compliance Officer he guided the firm through the current regulatory environment. Prior to 1994 Bob worked at New England Securities and Astor Securities.  He has been actively employed in financial services since 1981.  Bob received a degree in Mathematics from the University of Vermont in 1972 and a master’s degree from the Pennsylvania State University in 1974.  Bob is active in racquet sports, golf and skiing and lives in Wilton, CT with his wife Nancy. Read Bio James D. Taliaferro Portfolio Manager Close Jim serves as Portfolio Manager at Clear Harbor Asset Management. Prior to joining Clear Harbor, the majority of Jim’s career was spent with Kidder Peabody Incorporation, where he principally served as President, Chief Investment Officer, and Chief Executive Officer of Webster Management Corporation, the wholly-owned investment subsidiary of Kidder. In 1990 Jim founded Security Asset Management (now a division of Clear Harbor) where he served as CEO and Portfolio Manager. Jim has over fifty years of investment experience. His career began in 1969 in retail and institutional sales with Dominick & Dominick and Edwards & Hanly, where he was a registered representative until 1972. He then joined White, Weld & Co. where he became a Vice President and Senior Portfolio Manager for individual and institutional accounts. In 1978 he joined Webster Management where over the course of twelve years, he held several key positions including Senior Portfolio Manager and member of the Investment Policy Committee, Director of Marketing, Head of the Individual and Institutional Account Divisions, and finally, from 1985 through 1990, he was president, chief executive and Chief Investment Officer of the firm, as well as Chairman of the Board of the Kidder, Peabody family of mutual funds. Jim attended Parsons College and served in the U.S. Army in Vietnam. Read Bio Kirstin Mobyed Director Close Kirstin Mobyed Director Kirstin Mobyed serves as a Director at Clear Harbor Asset Management focused on developing comprehensive wealth management solutions for individuals, families as well as foundations and endowments. Kirstin leverages over 28 years of experience in the investment and financial services industries to deliver the firm’s portfolio of wealth management services and to help Clear Harbor clients achieve the goals and objectives most important to them. Prior to joining Clear Harbor, Kirstin was an Executive Director at Morgan Stanley. During her 27 years at Morgan Stanley and its predecessor firm (Legg Mason, Citigroup, Salomon Smith Barney), Kirstin served as an analyst, a portfolio manager and a client relationship manager. As an Investment Officer and Senior Portfolio Manager with Morgan Stanley’s Custom Solutions – Outsourced CIO Group, Kirstin was responsible for creating multi-asset class portfolios and unbiased, best-in-class wealth management solutions for individuals and institutional clients of the firm. With an emphasis on maintaining the highest standards of integrity and expertise, Kirstin is a trusted fiduciary passionate about providing objective, innovative, and client-centric solutions in clear terms so Clear Harbor clients understand their financial plan and feel empowered to take control of their lives. Ms Mobyed is an active member of the Girl Scouts and the Wilton Youth Council, an organization focused on positive youth development. Kirstin is a graduate of Providence College. Read Bio Matthew W. Sexton, CFP®, CIMA®, ChSNM Director Close Matthew W. Prior to joining Clear Harbor, Steven served as Managing Member and Chief Investment Officer of Little Oak Asset Management, LLC. Before working with Little Oak, Steven spent five years as the General Partner and Portfolio Manager of the Newgrange Strategic Value Fund, a value based long-short hedge fund focused on investing in mispriced securities across the capital structure. Prior to launching Newgrange, Steven was a Managing Director at Credit Suisse First Boston ("CSFB") responsible for co-heading the firm’s trading and distribution franchise. His responsibilities included the trading, risk management and distribution of cash corporate bonds, high yield and investment grade credit default swaps (CDS), and structured credit. While at CSFB, Steven focused on hedge fund and total return coverage where he was one of the firm's largest credit producers. Before joining CSFB, Steven was a Managing Director at Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette (which subsequently merged with CSFB), Kidder Peabody and Drexel Burnham. Read Bio Alexander M. Blanton Senior Analyst Close Alexander M. Blanton Senior Analyst Alex joined Clear Harbor Asset Management in January 2011 as a Senior Analyst. At Ingalls & Snyder LLC, which he joined in 1991, and where he was a Senior Vice President, Alex followed machinery and electronics manufacturing services (EMS) companies. Ryan has several years’ experience in in the wealth management industry, including client relationship management, operations, administrative support and compliance across various sectors. Before joining Clear Harbor, Ryan worked as a Senior Client Service Executive with J&E Davy, Ireland's leading financial services firm specializing in wealth management. Ryan graduated with a BA (Honors) Degree in Business from the National College of Ireland. Outside of work Ryan is an avid golfer and passionate Irish and Leinster rugby fan. Read Bio H. Christian Thalheim Analyst Close H. Christian Thalheim Analyst Christian Thalheim serves as an Analyst for Clear Harbor Asset Management and Spectrum Value Partners LP. He has experience in trading, operations, risk analysis, and investment research. At Clear Harbor, Christian focuses on reviewing client portfolios, systematizing processes, managing risk, and analyzing investment opportunities. He holds a bachelor’s degree in finance from the University of Connecticut. Read Bio Giorgia Turri Associate Close Giorgia Turri Associate Giorgia Turri is an Associate at Spectrum Value Partners, a long/short equity fund to which Clear Harbor is the investment adviser. She specializes in business development, marketing, financial analysis, and investor relations leveraging her expertise, education, and strategic client engagement. Prior to joining Spectrum Value Partners, Giorgia worked at AIEM Group, a renewable energy company in Italy that was later acquired by Impax Asset Management. She gained extensive experience in negotiating and closing large-scale photovoltaic projects, conducting due diligence, and crafting business plans to support investment strategies. Earlier in her career, she developed expertise in business development, marketing, and sales at Amazon Web Services (AWS), where she designed and implemented an EMEA-wide social selling strategy, and at EssilorLuxottica, where she supported cross-border sales initiatives between the U.S. and European markets. Giorgia holds a Master of Science in Sustainability Management from Columbia University, where she focused on sustainable finance and renewable energy investments. She also earned a Master of Science in Management from ESCP Business School, specializing in finance and strategy, and a Bachelor of Science in International Economics and Management from Bocconi University. Having lived in seven countries, Giorgia is fluent in multiple languages and adept at navigating diverse cultural and financial landscapes. Her global perspective enables her to build strong relationships with investors and stakeholders across international markets. Outside of work, she is an avid skier, white-water kayaker, and rock climber. Management Team Oak Harbor Capital Attractive Risk-Adjusted Returns About Oak Harbor Capital Investment Philosophy Competitive Advantages Management Team Current Opportunities Contact Us Investor Portal Investor Blossom Login Secure Blossom Login Blossom Access Information Management Team Oak Harbor Capital’s management team includes three Managers (William S. Weinstein, Michael Basile, and Peter J. Fitzpatrick). The team has an outstanding track record and a long history of certain of its members working together, both at Oak Harbor and earlier at a predecessor firm founded by the Principal, B-Line, LLC (âB-Lineâ). William S. Weinstein is the President and CEO of Oak Harbor Capital. Mr. Weinstein has practiced in the bankruptcy and creditor rights arena for 35 years. He is the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Oak Harbor Capital and the Co-Founder and a member of the Legal Services Provider. Mr. Weinstein started the Legal Services Provider in 1985 and it is now among the largest law firms focusing on creditor rights and bankruptcy in the United States. In 1997, he founded B-Line, one of the largest companies in the United States to purchase and service consumer finance related bankruptcy receivables. Under Mr. Weinsteinâs direction, B-Line deployed many hundreds of millions of dollars to acquire receivables that totaled over $46 billion in face value of debt. Between BâLine and the Legal Services Provider, approximately 40 million separate distressed debt accounts were purchased or serviced from 1997 to 2006. BâLine was sold in September 2006. Following the sale of B-Line, Mr. Weinstein launched Oak Harbor Capital, LLC and this investment management firm has become one of the largest buyers of distressed consumer debt in the United States. Mr. Weinstein has been an industry leader in developing predictive modeling, statistical and quantitative analysis, and pricing strategies for multiple classes of receivables. He is an honors graduate of Stanford University and Boston University School of Law. He has lectured extensively on bankruptcy, creditor rights, commercial litigation and regulatory and compliance issues in the United States and Canada. Michael L. Basile is the Chief Financial Officer of Oak Harbor Capital with over 15 years of experience in the receivables management industry, including his former roles of CFO and Chief Investment Officer at B-Line, LLC and management or consulting roles in multiple other consumer finance and distressed debt companies.Â  Prior management experience also included 5 years with Ernst & Young, LLP (specializing in the securities industry, auditing hedge funds, mutual funds, and fund-of-fund clients) and 4 years as Controller of the HealthPro division of CNA Financial. Mr. Basile holds both the Certified Public Accountant and Charted Global Management Accountant designations.Â  He earned his Bachelor of Science in Accounting from the University of Illinois and his Masters of Finance from Illinois Institute of Technology. Peter J. Fitzpatrick is the General Counsel and Chief Compliance Officer of Oak Harbor Capital. Mr. Fitzpatrick has practiced law for over 30 years. Prior to joining Oak Harbor Capital, he was a partner at K&L Gates LLP, where he served as Oak Harbor Capital’s longstanding outside legal counsel. Prior to commencing his legal career, Mr. Fitzpatrick was a lending officer at The Chase Manhattan Bank where he completed the Chase Credit Training Program with distinction. He also served as the Assistant to the Director of Labor Relations at Citibank, N.A. He graduated with honors from Harvard College and earned his law degree at Fordham Law School. Mr. Fitzpatrick was very involved in the early development of the secondary market for distressed debt and helped pioneer some of the original legal documentation used in the trading of distressed debt when the industry was in its nascent stage. Home Health Services - Oak Harbor Skip to content Home The Club About Gallery Lifestyle and Activities Extensive Sports and Social Activities Dining Wellness Home Health Services Membership Real Estate Resales Contact Us Home The Club About Gallery Lifestyle and Activities Extensive Sports and Social Activities Dining Wellness Home Health Services Membership Real Estate Resales Contact Us Home Health Services Welcome to Oak Harbor Home Health Services, your FL State licensed in home care provider. As we strive to further the continuum of care we provide at Oak Harbor, we have created this amenity to serve those who aren’t quite yet in need of full-time, permanent assisted living care, the likes of which are accommodated through our Somerset House Assisted Living Facility (License #AL9120). Instead, our goal is to provide part-time, temporary, or interim care to help residents, or prospective future residents of our age-in-place community with only the specific needs they wish to have some assistance with. To us, caring for people comes from the heart and is a combination of enthusiasm, interest, passion, and commitment. We are dedicated to the services we provide and will truly care for you and/or your loved one in times of need. Below are some examples of services we offer. Services Companion care Collect newspapers/mail Personal shopping Transportation services to local doctor appointments Nurse visits (RN/LPN) In home care by a Home Health Aide (“HHA”) or a Certified Nurses Assistant (“CNA”) Medication management Blood pressure and vitals readings on a periodic basis (daily, weekly, or monthly) Respite care Hospital and rehab stay companion The Club’s unique Health and Wellness Center is staffed by an on-site Registered Nurse who assists and advises Members with various medical matters including designing the proper home health care program when needed.  The care provided through the Oak Harbor Home Health allows Members’ families to know that their family member is receiving the best care in their own home. Members needing a more concentrated level of care can make arrangements through the Club’s Health and Wellness Center to enter Somerset House for short or long-term rehabilitation or for continuing assisted living. The facilities and services offered through the Club’s Health and Wellness Center provide a point of difference at Oak Harbor Club.  This amenity is one of the ways that the Oak Harbor Club keeps its Members’ needs as a central focus of the Club. 4755 S.
